The Dharma has immeasurable and boundless merits, and one can attain the immeasurable benefits.
Merits are the same as signlessness. From here on, it clarifies that there are great benefits. Now, it raises the signlessness of wisdom and eloquence to conclude the acceptance of the boundless.

The Buddha told ÅšrÄ«mÄlÄ, You should now explain what all buddhas have said about accepting the true Dharma and attaining the principle. The Dharma that is explained is called the One Vehicle. It is about to clarify the understanding of emptiness.

It is precisely the emergence of signlessness, so it commands her to explain it again. ÅšrÄ«mÄlÄ said to the Buddha, Excellent, World-Honored One! I will respectfully receive the teaching. Accepting the Dharma is vast and boundless, and seeking it may be endless. Why not explain the benefits of expounding it? She then said to the Buddha, World-Honored One, accepting the true Dharma is the MahÄyÄna. Accepting the understanding of emptiness,

Why is it so? The three vehicles' understanding of emptiness is all included in the one great MahÄyÄna. The great MahÄyÄna gives rise to all the good dharmas of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the mundane and supramundane. The three vehicles' understanding of emptiness all arises from principle.
Principle gives rise to without giving rise. Realization is the same as entering. Entering is without entering, therefore there is nothing that is not entered.

The meaning of one and three can be understood in this way. World-Honored One, just as the great lake Anavatapta gives rise to the eight great rivers, so does the MahÄyÄna give rise to all the good dharmas of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the mundane and supramundane. The spring source is vast and full, flowing with the openings.
The flows differ from the place of origin.
But the water is not different.
Just as the empty mind is vast, it obtains the name according to cultivation.
The name differs according to cultivation.
The empty understanding is always the same.
The same arises from the different, but there is no difference in the same. World-Honored One,
it is also like all seeds relying on the earth to grow and flourish.

In this way, all the good dharmas of the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the mundane and supramundane [paths] of the world rely on the MahÄyÄna to increase and grow. Their arising is no different, and their growth is the same.
Therefore, the World-Honored One,

abiding in the MahÄyÄna and embracing the MahÄyÄna, abides in the two vehicles and embraces the two vehicles, as well as all the good dharmas of the mundane and supramundane [paths] of the world. Governing them with principle, they are then called no different.
As the World-Honored One said, there are six aspects.
What are the six?

They are the abiding of the true Dharma, the extinction of the true Dharma, the PrÄtimoká¹£a, the Vinaya, going forth, and receiving the full precepts. These six aspects are taught for the sake of the MahÄyÄna. The ultimate Way is not sought by the small mind,
so it secretly explains the one principle with the names of the three provisional [vehicles].
Therefore, it was said earlier that the three vehicles emerge from the one ultimate.
Now, it is clarified that pointing to the great as the small aims to be inclusive of the great.
The great being inclusive is not the small, and this is what is called the great. Why is this so? The great and the small are not the same.

Why is it said that the small is the great Dharma abiding? It is for the sake of the Great Vehicle. Speaking of the Great Vehicle abiding is precisely the Great Dharma abiding. Speaking of the Great Dharma perishing is precisely the Great Vehicle perishing. The principle of emptiness is eternally still, unchanging throughout ancient and modern times.
To manifest it is abiding.
To conceal it is perishing.
How can there be abiding and perishing apart from the Great Vehicle? PÄrÄjika and vinaya, these two dharmas have the same meaning but different names. Restraining offenses is pÄrÄjika.
Curing offenses is vinaya.
These two are both the meaning of the Great Vehicle.
Yet they are given the designation of the Lesser Vehicle, thus it is said they have different names.
Different names, one principle.

Therefore, the Great Vehicle vinaya is precisely the Great Vehicle training. Restraining and curing the characteristics of separation are precisely the Great Vehicle training. Why is this? Restraining and curing originally come from the Lesser Vehicle.
Why is it identified with the Great? Because relying on the Buddha to leave home and receive full ordination, relying on the Great to speak of the Lesser, there is no separate Lesser.
Abandoning differences is leaving home.

Attaining the principle is considered complete. Therefore, it is said that the Mahayana is the precepts of deportment, the Vinaya, the going forth, and the full ordination. The Hinayana has no separate Hinayana, so the Mahayana is considered the Hinayana. Therefore, Arhats have no separate going forth and full ordination. Why is this? Because Arhats rely on the Tathagata to go forth and receive full ordination. Because there is no separate cause, the same goal arises.
Therefore, the meaning of the six aspects is none other than the Mahayana.
Arhats take refuge in the Buddha. Arhats have fear. The above discusses the opening and closing of the vehicle, clarifying that the principle is not different.
Below, it clarifies that there is one enlightenment, with characteristics that are exhausted and not exhausted.ğŸ”½The exhausted are called the vehicle without remainder.
The unexhausted is called the vehicle with remainder.
There are four kinds of remainder.
First, fear.
Second, birth and death.
Third, afflictions.
Fourth, knowable objects.
This first clarifies the remainder of fear.
As for cultivating the one vehicle and leaving characteristics,
it is for the sake of seeking the bliss of the unconditioned. Having not yet fully attained it,
Out of fear, they seek to put an end to it.

This mind is what they look up to and rely on the Great Awakened One. Why is it so? The sutra says that arhats have already attained the unconditioned, so how can they have fear? Arhats dwell in the thought of fearlessness towards all conditioned things, just as a person holding a sword wants to come and harm them. The two vehicles have not yet exhausted existence and have not yet exhausted non-existence. The conditioned is deeply feared by them. Therefore, arhats do not have ultimate bliss. Existence and non-existence are completely exhausted, and body and mind are tranquil.
The signless and unconditioned is called ultimate.
Arhats have not yet attained fearlessness. Why is it so? They obtain the name of ultimate.

Why is there no ultimate bliss? The World-Honored One relies on the unobtainable reliance, just as sentient beings have no reliance and are afraid here and there. Because of fear, they seek refuge. In this way, arhats have fear. Because of fear, they rely on the Tathagata. Those who have nothing to rely on and nothing to seek are only the Buddha alone.
Sentient beings have not yet awakened.

This is the place of fear. The Hinayana is gradual and incomplete, not leading to the ultimate. The World-Honored One, Arhats, and Pratyekabuddhas have fear. Above, the meaning of taking refuge in the Great is explained, so the Hearers are explained everywhere.
Below, the practice of not exhausting fear is clarified.

Therefore, it also includes the Two Vehicles. Therefore, Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas have remaining birth dharmas that are not exhausted, so there is birth. Although the Two Vehicles ultimately have four practices, they are called Nirvana without practice.

This is the remaining dharma of existence. There is the dharma of existence, and birth is not yet exhausted. Because the pure practice of existence is accomplished, the understanding is not pure. Although exhausted, there is not yet exhaustion in non-existence.

If existence and non-existence are exhausted, it is then called pure. Because the matter is not yet empty, there must be something to be done. The realization has not yet reached the ultimate principle, and there must be a method of understanding. It is not yet crossed, so there must be something to be eliminated. The continuation of later existence will definitely have further elimination.
The above then has the remaining four knowledges.ğŸ”½The first two clarify the non-exhaustion of what is to be exhausted.
The last two clarify the further arising of non-birth.

Because it is not exhausted yet, there is birth. Therefore, the later existence is not exhausted. Because it is not cut off, it is far from the realm of nirvana. The continuation of later existence means the endlessness of birth and death.
Therefore, it is far from nirvana. Why is this? The above five sentences are originally the name of nirvana without remainder.

Why is it said now that there is remainder? Only the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, attains parinirvÄá¹‡a and accomplishes all merits. Therefore, arhats and pratyekabuddhas do not accomplish all merits. As for those who are said to attain nirvana, it is the Buddha's skillful means to manifest the ultimate. To clarify the remainder, losing the spirit and reaching the ultimate principle is called equal enlightenment. The extinction of characteristics without extinction is called attaining nirvana.

Nirvana that has the name of exhaustion is called all exhaustion. Non-arising means my birth is already exhausted. The two vehicles are not yet able to exhaust existence and accept the name of nirvana. Using the final name to draw the beginning, they are far the same as non-arising.

Immediately giving rise to the remainder of birth explains the above having the remainder of birth. Only the TathÄgata attains parinirvÄá¹‡a and accomplishes immeasurable merit. Arhats and pratyekabuddhas accomplish immeasurable merit. Saying they attain nirvÄá¹‡a is a skillful means of the Buddha. The immeasurable practices are able to exhaust ignorance. The holy life has been established.

Explains the above the holy life is not pure. Only the TathÄgata attains parinirvÄá¹‡a and accomplishes inconceivable merit. Arhats and pratyekabuddhas accomplish conceivable merit. Saying they attain nirvÄá¹‡a is a skillful means of the Buddha. Inconceivable refers to the perfect and unobstructed state.
If the practice is able to reach perfection, then what should be done has been done.

Explains the above there is something that should be done. Only the TathÄgata attains parinirvÄá¹‡a and completely eliminates all faults that should be eliminated, accomplishing the foremost purity. Arhats and pratyekabuddhas have remaining faults and are not of the foremost purity. Saying they attain nirvÄá¹‡a is a skillful means of the Buddha. Extinguishing all continuity is to eliminate.

It is explained above that what is to be eliminated exists, and only the TathÄgata attains parinirvÄá¹‡a, becoming the object of reverence for all sentient beings, transcending the realms of arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas. Therefore, arhats and pratyekabuddhas are far from the realm of nirvÄá¹‡a. Cultivating the four virtues, they transcend the three vehicles. The two vehicles are still unable to explain this.
Having ascended far from the realm of nirvÄá¹‡a, the beginning and end are already revealed.
Therefore, there is still more to be illuminated.

It is said that arhats and pratyekabuddhas observe liberation and attain the four knowledges, reaching the end of their respite. This is also the TathÄgata's skillful means, provisional and not definitive. These three phrases first speak of reaching the end.
Now, about to clarify these three provisional meanings, it opens up the meaning of the following three chapters.
Therefore, it lists them. Observing liberation opens up the existence of afflictions.
The four knowledges reach the end, opening up the existence of what is to be known, and attaining respite, opening up the existence of death. Why is it so? Since the principle is not yet complete,

What is meant by speaking of two kinds of ultimate death? They are the death of the segmented and the inconceivable transformation death. The explanation below is about leaving the segmented to be a place of relief.
Cutting off the four abodes is the view of liberation.
Making the four truths into the four knowledges.
These three meanings are fully contained in the sÅ«tra.
Therefore, all the expedient means are called ultimate.
This first is the meaning of my birth is already exhausted that remains after death, which is common to the four gates.

Therefore, now it only clarifies the remaining death. The death of the segmented refers to the false and deceptive sentient beings. The inconceivable transformation death refers to the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and powerful bodhisattvas who have attained the body born of the fundamental cause. The segmented has the characteristics of having distinctions and not having distinctions.
In general, from causes one attains results.
The results follow the names of the causes.
Therefore, falsely grasping at the causes of existence and non-existence attains the distinctions.
The rewards of existence and non-existence are called the death of the segmented.
The understanding of emptiness and the signless attains the inconceivable rewards.
But because the retribution has not yet exhausted the ultimate principle,
there is the principle of transformation.
It is called the inconceivable transformation death, taking the analogy from the mind.

Therefore, it is said to be the body born of the mind. Up to the ultimate unsurpassed enlightenment. Enlightenment is quiescent extinction, forever free from this calamity, therefore it is called ultimate.

Below this, from it comes transformation, and one is not yet able to be without it. Among the two kinds of death, because of the death of the compounded, it is said that the wisdom of arhats and pratyekabuddhas has exhausted their birth. The wisdom of the two vehicles has already exhausted the false grasping, or the cause.

Without the birth of the compounded, one attains the fruit of the remainder. Therefore, it is said that the practice of purity is already established. The realization within the exhausted speaks of the practice of purity. What ordinary people and gods are unable to accomplish, the seven kinds of learners have not done before. The false and deceptive afflictions are cut off, therefore it is said that what is to be done is already accomplished. There is only the fruit of the two vehicles.
The wisdom that can exhaust the false and deceptive.

Below this, what has not yet been discussed. Because Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas have eliminated afflictions and will no longer undergo rebirth, it is said that they do not undergo rebirth. The seeds that have been exhausted will no longer produce fruits in the future, so it is said that they do not undergo rebirth. It is not that all afflictions have been exhausted, nor that all rebirths have been exhausted, so it is said that they do not undergo rebirth. It clarifies that the seeds have not yet been completely exhausted,

Causing future births to continue endlessly. The remaining causes and effects bind one to future rebirths. Why is this? There are afflictions that Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas are unable to eliminate, giving rise to fear of birth and death due to delusion.
Next, it clarifies that afflictions remain.
There are two wheels of essence and vigor.
Only the Great Enlightenment can clarify them, not what the Two Vehicles are able to eliminate.
Although the principle is profound and abstruse,
I will still try to discuss it.
The vastness of birth and death, one cannot trace its beginning. It is always tranquil and subtle, no one knows its end.
Although the beginning and end are difficult to clarify,
Yet there is a reason for pursuing it.
Samsara arises from conceptual mind, while nirvana lies in wondrous enlightenment.
If enlightenment has not yet fully plumbed the ultimate truth, it is still conceptual.
First, there is false existence.
Second, there is false non-existence.ğŸ”½False existence is coarse.
False non-existence is subtle.
If one realizes the truth, one eliminates confusion and cuts through the coarse, reaching the subtle.
The two vehicles have not yet exhausted non-existence, therefore,

they have something that is not yet eliminated, which is the ground of nescience. Afflictions are of two kinds. What are the two? They are the ground afflictions and the arising afflictions. The essence of afflictions is of two kinds: arising and non-arising.
The reason for this is as follows.
Mistakenly grasping different principles is view, while being attached to things is craving.
Not recognizing reality is ignorance.
Craving and view, which are confused about principle and also have something grasped, are called heavy.
Ignorance is simply not recognizing principle.
There is nothing else to focus on, so it is called subtle.

The two sections on light and heavy each have grounds of abiding and afflictions that arise. There are four kinds of grounds of abiding, what are the four? They are the ground of abiding in views, the ground of abiding in desire, the ground of abiding in attachment to form, and the ground of abiding in attachment to existence. The arising of afflictions and bonds,

The two sections on light and heavy each have grounds of abiding and afflictions that arise. There are four kinds of grounds of abiding, what are the four? They are the ground of abiding in views, the ground of abiding in desire, the ground of abiding in attachment to form, and the ground of abiding in attachment to existence. The arising of afflictions and bonds is necessarily conditioned. Therefore, there are four names.
The first is arising from delusion of principle, which is the same place, thus it is called one.
Attachment arises according to matters, thus it follows the realm to receive the name.
Therefore, views and attachment together form the four abidings.
These four are each guarding their own part as abiding.

They are able to give rise to as the ground. These four grounds of abiding give rise to all arising afflictions. The arising ones are momentary mind and momentary corresponding. They arise from white conditions as arising. They temporarily meet as a moment.

They immediately obscure that mind as corresponding. The World-Honored One said, The ground of abiding in beginningless ignorance that is not corresponding with the mind is also a condition, but is not called corresponding. It has existed for a long eon, thus it is called beginningless.
The condition of delusion of principle is thus called ignorance.
The four abodes of attachment are also not corresponding. When the four abodes of attachment arise, they are corresponding. When the abode of attachment to nescience arises, it is also corresponding.
There are two kinds of correspondence.
The first is the arising and ceasing of mental factors corresponding to conditions.
The second is obscurity or correspondence with the mind.
Now, it clarifies correspondence with the mind.ğŸ”½The characteristics and conditions of the three realms are the mind-consciousness.
The emptiness of the essence of the three vehicles is the mind-wisdom.
Because it arises within the characteristics of the four abodes of attachment,
it corresponds with the mind-consciousness.
The subtle obscurity that extends far also obscures that mind-wisdom. It corresponds with the mind-wisdom. Within the characteristics, the obstacles are heavy.
The four abodes of attachment are called going beyond the characteristics and wisdom-mind. Nescience is called not consciousness. Then wisdom is not non-corresponding with characteristics.
Therefore, the four abodes of attachment and the abode of attachment to nescience are all non-corresponding.
The two families that arise are all corresponding.
Nescience is beginningless. The four abodes of attachment are also like this.
But the four abodes of attachment that arise,
arising is not always arising.
Nescience is deluded about principle.
It has never not arisen.
When it arises, it does not always arise.
This is why there is a beginning.
It has never not arisen.
This is why there is no beginning.
Therefore, the stage of ignorance is called beginningless ignorance.
Dependent origination is present in the four abodes.
It is in all minds, good, evil, and neutral.
It is a stage based on conditions.
It is called associated based on arising.
The subtle or obscure pervades everywhere, and its characteristics are called principles. It also encompasses the subtle and removes the characteristics.
The four abodes of afflictions pervade the consciousness mind but do not pervade the mind wisdom. The arising characteristics are only in themselves and not in other minds.
The subtle or deep conditions pervade dependent origination.
The differentiated conditions give rise to differences.

Based on this, one can know that the power of these four abodes of afflictions is the basis for all higher afflictions. Compared to the stage of ignorance, it cannot be reached by counting or analogy. The names of the higher afflictions are different.
Below, it clarifies that the power of the ground of nescience is superior to that of the four abodes of craving.
It takes conditions as its basis and similar arising as its seeds.
It briefly mentions dependent arising, therefore saying based on seeds to compare the power of nescience.
The power that cannot reach manifest characteristics can be calculated, but the power of nescience is difficult to know.

How can the existent be compared to the non-existent and be equal? The World-Honored One, the power of the ground of nescience is the greatest among the four abodes of craving. Above, the four abodes are compared to the seeds of nescience.

Now, the power of nescience is compared to the four abodes below using a metaphor. It is like the evil Mara PÄpÄ«yÄn, whose form, strength, lifespan, retinue, and possessions are supremely superior in the Heaven of Free Enjoyment of Manifestations by Others. In the same way, the power of the ground of nescience is the most supreme among the four abodes of craving. The heavenly demon occupies the highest position and leads the lower realms. Nescience governs the end based on the beginning.
How can the four abodes do this?

Therefore, it is superior. The four kinds of afflictions that arise from the ground of nescience and abide for a long time are also named after the afflictions that rely on the number of sand grains in the Ganges River.
It is not because they are unified.
They are named after the sand grains in the Ganges River.
Or because they are the beginning and end.

They cause the branches and twigs to abide for a long time. The wisdom of arhats and pratyekabuddhas cannot eliminate them. They can only be eliminated by the wisdom of the TathÄgata's enlightenment. The darkness of heavy obscurity
is not illuminated by fireflies.

Only the great enlightenment can illuminate the deep darkness. In this way, the World-Honored One, the ground of nescience is the most powerful. The Buddha eliminates it. It can be said to be great. The World-Honored One, it is also like the grasping that takes contaminated karma as its cause and gives rise to the three existences. It has already revealed its power.
Now it clarifies its function.

It also explains the phrase not completely experiencing rebirth above. In this way, the ground of nescience takes pure karma as its cause and gives rise to the three kinds of mind-made bodies of arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and powerful bodhisattvas. The four graspings are the conditions for the compounded.
Ignorance is the moisture that nourishes the transformation and change.ğŸ”½Although it is non-existent in the womb,
in the essence of life it has not yet reached the ultimate.
Because it has not yet reached the ultimate in the essence of life, it obscures those three grounds.
It causes the three vehicles to receive birth and not exhaust it.

Therefore, ignorance is the cause of the mind-made body and pure karma. The arising of these three kinds of mind-made bodies and the arising of pure karma depend on the ground of ignorance and have conditions, not without conditions. Therefore, the three kinds of mind-made bodies and the cause of pure karma are the ground of ignorance. The three do not arise by themselves. When they arise, they must have conditions. The ground of ignorance is the condition for the three. The World-Honored One thus counts the ground of attachment to existence as the fourth ground of attachment. It does not share the same function as the ground of ignorance. It clarifies the difference in nourishing birth from the beginning.

Now it clarifies the difference in eradication. The reason why they are not the same is that the ground of ignorance is different and separate from the four grounds of attachment. It is eradicated by the wisdom of Buddha's enlightenment. The two vehicles eradicate the four but not ignorance.

The Buddha has severed ignorance, which is different from the four that can be severed. Why is this? Arhats and pratyekabuddhas sever the four kinds of abodes, but they do not exhaust the outflows, do not attain mastery, and do not realize the above three stages are divided into three realms. The four abodes mistakenly grasp existence.
In existence, outflows arise, called the realm of outflows.
The abode of ignorance mistakenly grasps non-existence.
In non-existence, outflows arise, called the realm of no outflows.
The Buddha's stage is the quiescent extinction of existence and non-existence, called the realm of nirvana.
Therefore, although the two vehicles sever existence and outflows,
they have not severed the no outflows, hence it is said the no outflows are not exhausted.
This is the realm of ignorance.
They are bound by subtle afflictions and do not attain the realization of mastery.

If ignorance is not exhausted, what is there to realize? The exhaustion of the undefiled is precisely the exhaustion of the ground of ignorance. If it is not exhausted, then ignorance is not exhausted. World-Honored One, arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas in their final body are obscured by the ground of ignorance, and therefore they do not know and do not realize those dharmas. The bodhisattva of great power above the eighth stage,
now in their final body,
is at the end of the Dharma cloud.
The previous explanation of ignorance nourishing birth is like what is manifest,
therefore taking the bodhisattva of great power as the beginning,
causing them to exhaust the end of ignorance.
It clarifies that the later bodies are not exhausted,

and therefore in the stage of buddhahood they do not attain the mind of knowing and realizing. Because of not knowing and seeing, what should be eliminated is not eliminated and not ultimately seen. The buddha-dharmas that should be eliminated are not eliminated.

Or, because it is not yet severed, it is not ultimate. Because it is not severed, it is called liberation with remaining faults, not liberation from all faults. Then, my birth has remaining existence. This is called having remaining purity, not all purity. Then, the practice of austerity has remaining. It is called accomplishing remaining merits, not all merits. Then, what is done has remaining. Because it accomplishes remaining liberation, remaining purity, and remaining merits, it is known that suffering with remaining has remaining accumulation to realize, remaining cessation to cultivate, and remaining path. Because afflictions are not exhausted, it causes what is known to have remaining. This is called attaining partial nirvÄá¹‡a. Attaining partial nirvÄá¹‡a is called heading towards the realm of nirvÄá¹‡a, having something to penetrate, and attaining is called partial.
